text: Aleksis Kivi , born Alexis Stenvall, (10 October 1834 – 31 December 1872) was a Finnish writer. He wrote plays and poems and the first significant novel in the Finnish language, Seven Brothers (Finnish title: Seitsemän veljestä). He is considered one of the greatest authors in Finland.Kivi, Aleksis (1834 - 1872) The National Biography of Finland Kivi was born in Nurmijärvi.Aleksis Kivi – Encyclopædia Britannica He lived in time when all educated people in Finland spoke Swedish.
